Description: Terracotta part of portable stove; panel in high relief; diota; emerging from tendrils are stalks continuing along part of the projection like a satyrs beard; coarse dark red clay. Traces of resin residues. Damaged by fire. Traces of white slip and or paint. Red-brown clay with lime, silt and mica.
Curator's comments: Şahin (2001, 129) argues that the fabric, firing, workmanship and technique for this piece 'resemble the Halikarnassos group rather than the Egyptian group', citing it as evidence to support the satement 'this shows them to be imports and demonstrates that both local and imported wares were available in Egypt (Şahin 2001, 129, see A 1-3; after Didelot 1998: 275-306). parallel from Delos (Mayence 1905, 386, fig 27), likely imported from Knidos (Şahin 2001, 129). Traces of pine resin adheres to the inside of the stove (Valerie Steele pers. comm). Didelot, 0. 1998: Rechauds hellenistiques du Musee Greco-Romain d'Alexandrie: importations et productions locales, in J-Y Empereur (ed), Commerce et artisanat dans I'Alexandrie hellenistique et romaine (Bulletin de Correspondance Hellenique Supplement 33). Athens, Paris: 275-306. Mayence, F. 1905. Fouilles de Delos. Les rechauds en terre-cuite. Bulletin de Correspondance Hellenique 29: 373-404
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C900)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (LA.02) (Phase 3)
Şahin 2001 / Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities (p.191, 121, fig. 109: Na 1.)
Condition: Registration number has flaked off to some extent;
